page.title: 06Knostrop's Local Importance
page.content: The{Yorkshire Water Authority controls 10,000 miles of sewers, which take sewage to 608 works. The majority of works were built at roughly the same time and some are now crumbling with age. The{Y.W.A.}has, therefore, decided to spend{Â£19.2 million}on phasing out nine of the smaller works in the greater Leeds area and plumbing them into an upgraded{Knostrop. The demise of the smaller works will mean cleaner water courses and an annual saving of{Â£457,000.}To have renovated and rebuilt the outlying works to an acceptable standard would have cost{Â£21.3 million. { Knostrop}will now be expanded and improved, at a cost of{Â£14 million.}To complete the link with other works will cost{Â£5.2 million.
